FullDescription:
Save more when you pump with Esso| earn Smiles points^ on top of all that 
Enjoy up to 18.3% fuel savings* all year round 
Find out more about our latest promotions  
Locate your nearest Esso station
Terms&Conditions:
•1For  OCBC 365 cardmembers| the additional 4.3% rebate (equivalent to the OCBC 365 5%  cashback on the net fuel price) is provided if a cardmember charges a minimum  of $600 to his OCBC 365 credit card account within a month.  Computation of card spend is based on date of transaction posting.  Terms  and conditions of OCBC 365 credit card cashback programme applies| including a  cap of $80 cashback per month for all types of transactions apply - refer to www.ocbc.com/365card  for full details.  
•2For OCBC  Plus! Visa Cards| the 4.3% additional rebate is based on a cash rebate of S$15  for a minimum of $300 nett fuel purchase per month. Computation of $300 spend is based on date of transaction posting.  
•*Up  to 18.3% savings on fuel is based 14% upfront discount on gross fuel price at  Esso service stations and additional 4.3% rebate on the gross fuel price  (equivalent to 5% rebate on the nett fuel price) from OCBC. The 14% upfront  discount is computed as follows: (a) 5% Smiles Card discount| (b) 5% Esso  service station site discount and (c) 4% OCBC Credit/Debit card discount. All  other OCBC cards| including corporate cards will enjoy 14% savings on fuel.  Offer is not applicable to Private Label Cards. This promotion starts from 1  July 2014. Discount rates stated may be subject to change from time to time  without prior notice. Please check onsite for prevailing rates.  All  discounts will be given at point of sale and applied on prevailing pump prices  of fuel purchased. Rebates are computed based on total nett fuel purchases made  at Esso service stations in Singapore in a month using the same  Credit/Debit Card. To enjoy this promotion| Esso Smiles Card has to be  presented at point of purchase and payment must be made with an OCBC  Credit/Debit Card via Visa/MasterCard transaction. Full terms and conditions  are available at www.ocbc.com/cardspromotions. 
•^Smiles points equivalent to 2.6% fuel savings will be awarded| when 250 litres of Synergy fuel are purchased within a calendar month using the same Smiles card. 2.6% fuel savings is computed based on the pump price of Synergy 5000 as of 24 February 2015 and 750 Smiles points is equivalent to S$30 worth of Synergy fuel. Savings are computed based on the bonus tier Smiles points being awarded. Terms and conditions pertaining to the Smiles Driver Rewards programme apply. Please refer to the Smiles Driver Rewards programme at  www.essosmiles.com.sg for its terms and conditions.

FullDescription:
Enjoy 3% rebates on tickets for shows| concerts or sporting events at: 
OCBC Aquatic Centre| OCBC Arena| National Stadium| Singapore Indoor Stadium or Water Sport Centre 
Enjoy 3% rebates on entrance fees or booking of facilities at: 
OCBC Aquatic Centre| OCBC Arena or Water Sports Centre
Terms&Conditions:
•Terms & conditions governing the 3% Cash Rebates Programme at the Singapore Sportshub 
•The 3% Cash Rebates Programme at Singapore Sportshub is a unique programme for OCBC Consumer Credit Card Cardmembers only. It is not applicable for OCBC Consumer Debit| Business Debit| Business Credit| Corporate| or PLC Card Cardmembers.  
•The 3% cash rebate is awarded on the following: 
•(1) purchase of tickets for shows| concerts or sporting events at the OCBC Arena| OCBC Aquatic Centre| National Stadium| Singapore Indoor Stadium or Water Sports Centre; or  
•(2) payment of entrance fees and booking fees for facilities at OCBC Arena| OCBC Aquatic Centre or the Water Sports centre (the “Qualifying Spend”). 
•Unless specified above| the 3% cash rebate is not applicable to any other spend at Singapore Sportshub. 
•The 3% cash rebate is not applicable for purchase of tickets to events at the Singapore Sports Hub through SingPost. 
•The cash rebate earned by both Principal and Supplementary Credit Card Cardmembers will be aggregated and credited to the Principal Cardmember’s Credit Card account and reflected in the billing statement for the following month. 
•Cash rebates are computed based on 2 decimal places per transaction with any rounding up. 
•If a Principal Cardmember's Card Account is terminated for any reason (whether by OCBC or the Principal Cardmember)| both Principal and Supplementary Cardmembers will be disqualified from participating in the 3% Cash Rebates Programme at Singapore Sportshub and any accumulated rebates shall be automatically forfeited; such rebates shall not be transferable to any other card account.  
•If a Supplementary Card is terminated for any reason| the Principal Cardmember will still be eligible to participate in the 3% Cash Rebates Programme at the Singapore Sportshub. 
•For OCBC FRANK Credit Card: 
•(1) The terms and conditions of the FRANK Cash Rebates Rewards Programme will apply for FRANK Credit Cardmembers. The cash rebate earned under the “3% Cash Rebates Programme at Singapore Sportshub” for FRANK Credit Cardmembers will be computed as part of the monthly maximum rebate capped at S$60.  
•(2) If your total spend in the same month on retail| online and Auto-top-up (ATU) transactions on your Frank Credit Card exceeds $500| you will enjoy an additional 3% rebate on the Qualifying Spend if your payment was made online and charged to your FRANK Credit Card. 
•For OCBC 365 Credit Card 
•(1) The terms and conditions of the OCBC 365 Credit Card Cashback Programme will apply for OCBC 365 Credit Cardmembers. The cash rebate earned under the “3% Cash Rebates Rewards Programme at Singapore Sportshub” for OCBC 365 Credit Cardmembers will be computed as part of the monthly maximum cashback capped at S$80.  
•(2) OCBC 365 Credit Cardmembers will enjoy a maximum of 3% cash rebates at Singapore Sportshub regardless of whether the transaction is conducted online or at relevant box offices at Singapore Sportshub. 
•For OCBC Great Eastern Cashflo Credit Card 
•(1) The terms and conditions of the OCBC Great Eastern Cashflo Credit Card Cash Rebates Rewards Programme will apply for OCBC Great Eastern Cashflo Credit Cardmembers.  
•(2) The cash rebate earned under the “3% Cash Rebates Programme at Singapore Sportshub” for OCBC Great Eastern Cashflo Credit Cardmembers will be computed as part of the monthly maximum rebate capped at S$100. 
•For OCBC Cashflo Credit Card 
•(1) The terms and conditions of the OCBC Cashflo Credit Card Cash Rebates Rewards Programme will apply for OCBC Cashflo Credit Cardmembers.  
•(2) The cash rebate earned under the “3% Cash Rebates Programme at Singapore Sportshub” for OCBC Cashflo Credit Cardmembers will be computed as part of the monthly maximum rebate capped at S$100.  
•Qualifying spend charged to the Card but have yet to be posted to the Card Account will not be taken into account in the computation of cash rebates to be awarded. 
•Cash rebates awarded by OCBC in respect of the reversed retail purchases will be deducted from the cash rebates computed for the following month spend. Any cash rebates deducted due to reversed transactions will be reflected in the Billing Statement of the following month.  
•We may retract| deduct and/or re-compute any cash rebates awarded if you fail to effect due payment for the Card Transactions or the Card Account is terminated by you or OCBC for any reason. 
•Any cash rebates awarded will be reflected in the Billing Statement provided on a monthly basis. The cash rebates will automatically be applied to pay part of the billed amount for that month. We reserve the right to replace the cash rebates with another item or kind of reward as we may determine without giving any reason or notice at any time and from time to time. 
•We reserve the right at any time without giving any reason or notice to you to deduct| withdraw or cancel any cash rebates awarded to you without liability. You will not be entitled to any payment or compensation whatsoever in respect of such deduction| withdrawal or cancellation. 
•We may| at our sole discretion and without giving any reason or notice| suspend the cash rebates rewards programme at any time. 
•The award and crediting of cash rebates to your Card Account will be entirely at our discretion and we shall not be liable or responsible for any loss or damage suffered or incurred by you arising from or in connection with the cash rebates and/or the Card. Our decision on all matters relating to or in connection with the Card (including 3% Cash Rebates Programme) shall be final and binding on you. 
•In the event of any inconsistency between these Terms & Conditions and any brochure| marketing or promotional material relating to the Card| these Terms &Conditions shall prevail. 
•We have the right to end this programme or change any terms and conditions (including but not limited to the cash rebates and eligibility criteria) without giving any reason or notice at any time and from time to time. 
•You allow us to reveal information about you or your account to any person; including the people involved in organising| promoting and carrying out promotions and/or this programme as we see fit.  
•The laws of Singapore apply to these terms and conditions| and any disputes between you and us will be dealt with in the courts of Singapore. Under the Contracts (Rights of Third Parties) Act (Cap 53B)| a person who is not a party to any agreement governed by these terms and conditions does not have the right to enforce any of these terms and conditions. 
•The Bank’s decisions on all matters relating to 3% Cash Rebates Programme shall be final and binding on all participants. No correspondence or appeal shall be entertained by the Bank. In the event of any inconsistency between these terms and conditions and any brochure| marketing or promotional material relating to the 3% Cash Rebates Programme| these terms and conditions shall prevail.

Synopsis 
Ever wondered what else happened to Sleeping Beauty when she finally woke up in the 21st century? Alan Ayckbourn provides the answer with this alternative seasonal fare in the musical Awaking Beauty. The prince awakens Princess Aurora and the eager| happy young couple are about to embark on their first night of passionate love when ugly| unloved Carabosse| the wicked witch| butts in having taken a fancy to the prince. But which one will be the Awaking Beauty? Love| lust| triplets and the ultimate in makeovers are just some of the milestones our heroes and heroines must pass before they can all live happily ever after. Join the Song and Dance Players| a young local musical theatre group| as we take on this exciting production!"

Synopsis: 
Wow! Merlion questions the sensitivity and sensibility of Singaporeans| finding their own voices within the perplexities| anxieties| hopes| and dreams of our land. Wow! Merlion paints the abstract| and sometimes absurd narratives in relation to the surrounding culture and lifestyle of Singaporeans through a harmonious integration of dance| art| and music.
In celebrating SG50| Wow! Merlion showcases a series of Asian icons & nuances through the eyes of ODT's Artistic Director and choreographer Dr. Danny Tan in collaboration with eminent visual artist Mr. Chieu Shuey Fook| with performance by ODT Main Company and ODT Music Ensemble. Merlion.

FullDescription:
Description 
10% off tickets for all OCBC Cardmembers
Date:  21 January to 24 January 2016 
Operating Hours:  21 Jan| Thu: 12pm to 8pm 
22 Jan| Fri: 12pm to 7pm 
23 Jan| Sat: 11am to 7pm 
24 Jan| Sun: 11am to 6pm 
Ticket Prices: 1 Day Pass - $32  
4 Day Pass - $64  
Prices exclude SISTIC handling fee 
Venue:  Marina Bay Sands Expo and Convention Centre| Halls D| E| F  
Ticketing Venue:  
All SISTIC counters and website| and Art Stage Singapore Ticketing Box Office during the fair. 
To book tickets to the above performance| please visit the website here. 
Synopsis: 
Art Stage Singapore| the flagship art fair of Southeast Asia| kicks off the international art season every January with the very best of Asian contemporary art. It bookmarks Singapore on the map as the definitive meeting point between the diverse regional and global art scenes. The Fair is a catalyst in driving international interest in and understanding of Southeast Asian contemporary art.  
With a strong network of galleries| collectors| artists| and industry professionals| Art Stage Singapore plays a pivotal role in unifying the various art markets in the region to forge a collective and singular Southeast Asian art market. The Fair also acts as a forum for discourse and debate| engaging audiences with a deeper understanding of pertinent issues in Southeast Asia. Launched in 2015| the Joseph Balestier Award for the Freedom of Art| jointly presented by Art Stage Singapore and the Embassy of United States in Singapore| honours an artist or curator from the region whose work continuously seeks to express the ideals of freedom and liberty.   
Beyond the Fair in January| Art Stage Singapore also collaborates with local and regional art galleries and communities to organise exciting contemporary art events throughout the year. Since its inaugural edition in 2011| Art Stage Singapore has galvanized the arts scene in Singapore| leading to the creation of Singapore Art Week - an initiative led by the National Arts Council| in partnership with the Singapore Tourism Board and Economic Development Board of Singapore.
Terms&Conditions:
•Offers are not valid with other promotions| offers or privileges. 
•Payment must be made with an OCBC Master or Visa Credit/Debit Card.  
•Other terms and conditions apply.

Synopsis: 
Local pianist Ryan Chow| a graduate of Singapore Management University and Manhattan School of Music| presents a masterful concoction of works from the early retrospectivism of Mendelssohn and Grieg which culminated in the mature neoclassical works of the interwar period. A distinct trend which infiltrates early modernism in music| the programme looks back to the Classical and Baroque guised in a modern sound palette. This concert is proudly presented by MS Works.

Synopsis: 
From the sea comes a red demon. Certain that the demon is here to devour humans| the villagers are in fear. By the sea live three characters -- A woman| her brother| the village idiot| and a man who gets jealous easily. 
Miraculously| the trio find themselves communicating with the demon despite not speaking its language. Moreover| they realize it is here on a mission. Meanwhile| the villagers march| torches in hand| ready to kill the demon?
Written by acclaimed Japanese playwright Noda Hideki and directed by Nelson Chia| Nine Years Theatre brings you a tale about man-eating demons and demon-eating men.

Synopsis: 
A Chinese Rock Musical  
A love story that transcends life and death  
Fate is when the scholar Sang Xiao meets the vixen fox Ying Ning. 
Affection is when Ying Ning hides her identity to be with a mortal. 
Mishap is when the priest Cheng Ban Xian exposes her secret. 
Folly is when Sang Xiao is tricked by the water spirit Feng San Niang. 
Love is when Ying Ning risks her life to enter the Underworld.  
Will the bittersweet lovers escape the bane of King Yama and change their destiny?  ÿ
From the creative talents behind "If There're Seasons..." and Lao Jiu: The Musical comes another long-awaited original Chinese musical| Liao Zhai Rocks!. First staged by The Theatre Practice in 2010| Liao Zhai Rocks! is finally back after 6 long years! Watch sparks fly as the stellar new cast tell a story of forbidden love that transcends life and death through the energy and expression of rock music.
